question.sample_exam1: An obese 25-year-old female presents with infertility problems. She has a history of oligomenorrhea. PE reveals hirsutism on the face. Ultrasound reveals an enlarged right ovary. What would be the expected laboratory results?
question.sample_exam3: A 25-year-old obese female reports infertility with hirsutism. She has a history of oligomenorrhea. Ultrasound shows an enlarged right ovary which was diagnosed as polycystic ovarian syndrome. What are the expected laboratory results?

sample_exam1.a: Serum FSH - increased; Serum LH - increased; Serum Testosterone - increased; TSH - normal
sample_exam1.b: Serum FSH - decreased; Serum LH - decreased; Serum Testosterone decreased; TSH - decreased
sample_exam1.c: Serum FSH - increased; Serum LH - decreased;
sample_exam1.d: Serum FSH - decreased; Serum LH - increased; Serum Testosterone - normal; TSH - increased

sample_exam3.a: Increased LH, Increased FSH, Increased Testosterone, Normal TSH
sample_exam3.b: Increased LH, Increased FSH, Decreased Testosterone, Normal TSH
sample_exam3.c: Increased LH, Decreased FSH, Decreased Testosterone, Normal TSH
sample_exam3.d: Increased LH, Decreased FSH, Increased Testosterone, Normal TSH

question.sample_exam1: A 60 yr old female actress complains of a 2.0 cm, slow-growing, left buccal mucosa mass. She also complains of dull, constant pain. Excision was done and microscopy revealed tubular and cribriform structures with microcysts lined by small cells with dark, compact nuclei. TRUE of this neoplasm:
question.sample_exam2: A 60-year-old female actress complains of a 2.0 cm, slow-growing, left buccal mucosa mass. She also complains of dull, constant pain. Excision was done and microscopy revealed tubular and cribriform structures with microcysts lined by small cells with dark, compact nuclei. TRUE of this neoplasm:

sample_exam1.a: Lymphovascular invasion can account for the pain symptoms
sample_exam1.b: It is the most common malignant salivary gland neoplasm
sample_exam1.c: Commonly metastasizes to the lymph node
sample_exam1.d: It is a slow-growing salivary gland tumor

sample_exam2.a: Has a propensity to recur locally
sample_exam2.b: Lymphovascular invasion can account for the pain symptoms
sample_exam2.c: It is the most common malignant salivary gland neoplasm
sample_exam2.d: It is a slow-growing salivary gland tumor

sample_exam2.section: Head & Neck Pathology II: Nose, Ear, Salivary Glands
sample_exam2.reference: 3/18 D - Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma  It is a slow-growing salivary gland tumor

question.sample_exam1: A 19 yr old male develops painful vesicles near his mouth, along with low-grade fever and palpable submandibular lymph nodes. question.sample_exam2: A 19-year-old male develops painful vesicles near his mouth, along with low grade fever and palpable submandibular lymph nodes. The attending physician noted grouped vesicles on an erythematous base. Tzanck smear was done on the vesicle fluid. The following histologic findings will suggest an HSV infection, EXCEPT:

sample_exam2.e: All of the above findings are correct

sample_exam2.reference:
3/18 Herpes Simplex Infection:
- Acantholysis-Dissolution of the intercellular bridges that connect squamous epithelial cells
- Intranuclear Viral Inclusion-Cowdry Type A inclusion bodies
- Multinucleated Giant Cells (Polykaryon)- via Tzanck Smear

question.sample_exam1: What is the pathogenesis of Marble Bone Disease?
question.sample_exam3: What is the pathogenesis of osteopetrosis?

sample_exam1.a: Poor osteoclast function due to a mutation in carbonic anhydrase 2 (CA2)
sample_exam1.d: Imbalance in osteoblast and osteoclast activity with an osteoclastic activity, mixed with osteoblastic/osteoclastic activity, followed by an osteoblastic activity

sample_exam3.a: Impaired osteoclast function due to the mutation in CLCN7
sample_exam3.d: Imbalance in osteoblast and osteoclast activity with an osteoclastic activity, mixed with osteoblastic/ osteoclastic activity, followed by an osteoblastic activity

question.sample_exam1: A 38 yr old woman has had episodes of numbness and tingling in both hands for 5 months. The problem typically occurs near the end of the day and makes it difficult for her to use the computer keyboard. The thumb and first two fingers are most affected. There is no pain or swelling, and she does not recall any trauma to the upper extremities. On physical examination, thenar muscle atrophy seems to be present. Which of the following conditions is most likely causing her problem?
question.sample_exam3: The department secretary has been complaining of numbness in both of her hands for the past 3 months. The problem typically occurs near the end of the day and makes it difficult for her to use the computer keyboard. The thumb and first two fingers are most affected. Which of the following conditions is most likely causing her problem?

question.sample_exam1: A female medical student has had decreased vision on the left for 6 months. On physical examination. there is papilledema on the right. She has 14 scattered, 2-to-5 cm flat, hyperpigmented skin lesions with irregular borders on the extremities and torso. CT scan of the head shows a mass in the region of the right optic nerve. An optic nerve glioma is excised. Eight months later, she returns for a follow-up examination, and a mass is palpated on the right wrist. Histologic examination of the mass is most likely to show which of the following neoplasms?
question.sample_exam3: A 23F with decreased visual acuity on L eye for 6 months. PE showed papilledema on R, several scattered 2-5cm flat hyperpigmented skin lesions with irregular border on extremity and trunk. CT scan showed R optic nerve glioma which was excised. 8 months later on follow up, a mass on Right wrist was noted. Which of the following neoplasms would show on histopathology?

sample_exam3.d: Sporadic cases are linked to mutations due to exposure to UV radiation in sunlight

sample_exam2.section: Head & Neck Pathology I: Oral & Neck
sample_exam2.reference: 2/18 A- AKA Dysplastic leukoplakia characterized by Red, velvety, possibly eroded area within the oral cavity that usually remains level with or may be slightly depressed relative to the surrounding mucosa. 50% risk of malignant transformation.

question.sample_exam2: A 37-year-old male is brought to the emergency room by his wife because he started to vomit bright red blood at home. Over the past year, he has frequently complained of abdominal pain while eating a meal, and, as such, has lost about 40 lbs. He has no past medical history and is on no medications. He consumes about 1 beer per day and has a 10-pack per-year history of smoking. Of the following, what is the most likely source of his bleeding?
question.sample_exam3: A 55-year-old male alcoholic is brought to the emergency room by his wife because he started to vomit bright red blood at home. Over the past year, he has frequently complained of abdominal pain while eating a meal, and, as such, has lost about 40 lbs. He has no past medical history and is on no medications. He consumes about 1 beer per day and has a 10-pack per-year history of smoking. Of the following, what is the most likely source of his bleeding? (unsure)

sample_exam2.reference:
7/18 Pertinent data:
- Hematemesis
- Abdominal pain while eating a meal
- 1 beer per day
- 10 pack per year history of smoking

question.sample_exam2: A 47-year-old male has had abdominal pain for about 4 months. His physician has prescribed omeprazole, which has not apparently worked. He sought consult again, this time complaining of a nodule at his umbilicus. He has no other significant past medical history. Biopsy of the nodule reveals neoplastic cells with a signet ring appearance. He undergoes an exploratory laparotomy. Of the following, which is the surgeon likely to find?
question.sample_exam3: A 55-year-old male has had abdominal pain for about 4 months. His physician has prescribed omeprazole, which has not apparently worked. He sought consult again, this time complaining of a nodule at his umbilicus. He has no other significant past medical history. Biopsy of the nodule reveals neoplastic cells with a signet ring appearance. He undergoes an exploratory laparotomy. Of the following, which is the surgeon likely to find?

sample_exam2.a: A large ulcerated mass in the body of the stomach
sample_exam2.b: Diffuse thickening of the wall of the stomach
sample_exam2.c: A red and yellow mass in the cortex of a kidney
sample_exam2.d: An ulcerated mass in the large intestine

sample_exam3.a: A large ulcerated mass in the body of the stomach
sample_exam3.b: Diffuse thickening of the wall of the stomach
sample_exam3.c: A red and yellow mass in the cortex of a kidney
sample_exam3.d: An ulcerated mass in the large intestine

sample_exam2.reference:
7/18 Pertinent data:
- Nodule at umbilicus reveals neoplastic cells with signet ring appearance 
- Primary impression: Adenocarcinoma, Diffuse type
